snippet: Li Keqiang has been exposed to a rich palette of liberal thinking, but he will be hemmed in by the conservatives who dominate the seven-seat Politburo Standing Committee.
abstract: Man in the News profile of Li Keqiang, who will step into role of China's prime minister in 2013; Li, who has been exposed to rich palette of liberal thinking, carries hopes of reform-minded members of his generation, but will be hemmed in by conservatives dominating seven-seat Politburo Standing Committee.

byline.contributor: Ian Johnson contributed reporting. Patrick Zuo, Amy Qin and Chang Lu contributed research.

lead_paragraph: Li Keqiang has been exposed to a rich palette of liberal thinking, but he will be hemmed in by the conservatives who dominate the seven-seat Politburo Standing Committee.

headline.seo: Li Keqiang Named China’s Prime Minister
headline.main: Liberal Background, but Limited Leeway, for a New Premier
headline.print_headline: Liberal Background, But Limited Leeway, For a New Premier
headline.content_kicker: Man in the News | Li Keqiang
